Core classes¶

Module name: openqml.core

The Optimizer class is based on MLtoolbox by Maria Schuld.

Classes¶

Optimizer(cost_func, cost_grad, weights, *) Quantum circuit optimizer.

weights Current weights.
train([max_steps]) Optimize the system.

exception openqml.core.StopOptimization[source]¶

Exception for stopping the optimization.

class openqml.core.Optimizer(cost_func, cost_grad, weights, *, n_data=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Quantum circuit optimizer.

Optimization hyperparameters are given as keyword arguments.

Parameters:
  • cost_func (callable) – Cost/error function. Typically involves the evaluation of one or more QNode instances representing variational quantum circuits. Takes two arguments: weights (array[float]) and optionally a batch of data item indices (Sequence[int]).
  • cost_grad (callable) – Gradient of the cost/error function with respect to the weights. Takes the same argumets as cost_func. Typically obtained using autograd as cost_grad = autograd.grad(cost_func, 0).
  • weights (array[float]) – initial values for the weights/optimization parameters
  • n_data (int) – total number of data samples to be used in training
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • optimizer (str) – ‘SGD’ or any optimizer not requiring a Hessian, compatible with scipy.optimize.minimize(): ‘Nelder-Mead’, ‘Powell’, ‘CG’, ‘BFGS’, ‘L-BFGS-B’, ‘TNC’, ‘SLSQP’
  • lambda (float) – regularization strength
  • regularizer (None, callable) – None, ‘L2’, or a custom function mapping Sequence[float] to float.
  • init_learning_rate (float) – SGD only: initial learning rate, usually around 0.1
  • decay (float) – SGD only: decay rate for the learning rate
  • batch_size (None, int) – SGD only: How many randomly chosen data samples to include in computing the cost function each iteration. None means all of them.
  • print_every (int) – add a status entry into the log every print_every iterations
_cost_func = None¶

callable – scalar function to be minimized

_cost_grad = None¶

callable – gradient of _cost_func

_n_data = None¶

int – total number of data samples to be used in training

stop = None¶

bool – flag, stop optimization

_hp = None¶

dict[str->]* – hyperparameters

_weights = None¶

array[float] – optimization parameters

weights¶

Current weights.

set_hp(**kwargs)[source]¶

Set hyperparameter values.

_reg_cost_L2(weights, grad=False)[source]¶

L2 regularization cost.

Parameters:
  • weights (array[float]) – optimization parameters
  • grad (bool) – should we return the gradient of the regularization cost instead?
Returns:

regularization cost or its gradient
Return type:

float, array[float]
_optimize_SGD(x0, max_steps)[source]¶

Stochastic Gradient Descent optimization.

Parameters:
  • x0 (array[float]) – initial values for the optimization parameters
  • max_steps (int) – maximum number of iterations for the algorithm
train(max_steps=100)[source]¶

Optimize the system.

Parameters:max_steps (int) – maximum number of steps for the algorithm
Returns:final cost function value
Return type:float
